item.title: Michelle add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "And if a friend does you wrong, then say: "I forgive you what you have done to me; that you have done it to YOURSELF, however--how could I forgive that!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's only after we've lost everything that we're free to do anything." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "People believe, thought Shadow. It's what people do. They believe, and then they do not take responsibility for their beliefs; they conjure things, and do not trust the conjuration. People populate the darkness; with ghost, with gods, with electrons, with tales. People imagine, and people believe; and it is that rock solid belief, that makes things happen." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ayn Rand
item.description: "What is man? He's just a collection of chemicals with delusions of grandeur." -- Ayn Rand

item.title: Michelle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A woman means by Unselfishness chiefly taking trouble for others; a man means not giving trouble to others...thus, while the woman thinks of doing good offices and the man of respecting other people’s rights, each sex, without any obvious unreason, can and does regard the other as radically selfish." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michelle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Prosperity knits a man to the world. He feels that he is finding his place in it, while really it is finding its place in him." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michelle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A moderated religion is as good for us as no religion at all—and more amusing." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michelle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Your patient has become humble; have you drawn his attention to the fact? All virtues are less formidable to us once the man is aware that he has them, but this is specially true of humility." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michelle add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "All is summed up in the prayer which a young female human is said to have uttered recently: "O God, make me a normal twentieth-century girl!" Thanks to our labors, this will mean increasingly: "Make me a minx, a moron, and a parasite." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Standing on the bare ground,--my head bathed by the blithe air and uplifted into infinite space,--all mean egotism vanishes. I become a transparent eyeball; I am nothing; I see all; the currents of the Universal Being circulate through me; I am part or parcel of God." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
